channel.title: What's the problem?
channel.description:
I don't see what's wrong with deltas mining and woodcutting which uses a switch statement! Loads of people complain but I don't know why?
Can someone explain why it is bad to use a switch statement!

item.title: What's the problem?
item.dc:creator: @The_Reaper_X The Reaper X
item.description:
@The_Reaper_X wrote:

[quote=“the elve age, post:5, topic:335976”][quote author=cows1471 link=topic=432356.msg3174133#msg3174133 date=1270676429]

When you write a skill you need to call it from a different class, and a config file using arrays.
Which delta just jams shit into process.

wrong sir.

And deltas stuff when fixed up a bit works just fine
[/quote]

Wrong? Hahahaha, you must think cramming everything into client.java is good.
Deltas stuff is shit processed (not just timers), and is jut crammed into the client.java which is horrid.[/quote]Moving a load of shit from one class to another isn’t any different. Yes, it’s more organized, but it still processes at the same efficiency. You don’t need a config file at all to make it stable. I agree on the arrays, but organization isn’t necessary to improve the rate of efficiency.

Read full topic

item.title: What's the problem?
item.dc:creator: @ChaosPkers ChaosPkers
item.description:
@ChaosPkers wrote:

nothings “wrong” with it but it can for sure use some work.

Read full topic

When you write a skill you need to call it from a different class, and a config file using arrays.
Which delta just jams shit into process.
[/quote]
wrong sir.

And deltas stuff when fixed up a bit works just fine[/quote]

Wrong? Hahahaha, you must think cramming everything into client.java is good.
Deltas stuff is shit processed (not just timers), and is jut crammed into the client.java which is horrid.

Read full topic

item.title: What's the problem?
item.dc:creator: @zuppers zuppers
item.description:
@zuppers wrote:

Lol switch statements are shunned upon by this community because the winterlove servers have huge switch statements. Now don’t misunderstand switch statements are not as horrible as people here make them out to be, but it gets annoying when people only use giant switch statements and not other methods such as enumeration and so forth.

Read full topic

item.title: What's the problem?
item.dc:creator: @the_elve_age the elve age
item.description:
@the_elve_age wrote:

[quote=“cows1471, post:1, topic:335976”]I don’t see what’s wrong with deltas mining and woodcutting which uses a switch statement! Loads of people complain but I don’t know why?

Can someone explain why it is bad to use a switch statement![/quote]

Who ever said that must be mento-retardo (switch statement)

As for delta’s wcing and mining. They don’t even work correctly, and don’t use events (trees reviving, ore’s turning gray)

When you write a skill you need to call it from a different class, and a config file using arrays.
Which delta just jams shit into process.

Read full topic
